intro: Majovskya haljamovae, commonly known as the Haljamovae majovskya, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and alpine environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in complex umbels, while its leaves are finely divided and lanceolate in shape. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
